pullRequest.title: Updated direct connection config APIs and docs
pullRequest.bodyText: Updated direct connection config APIs and docs

commit.message: Updated direct connection config APIs and docs

nodes.bodyText: what does 0 as idle connection timeout mean?

this.connectionTimeout = null;	
why is this null?
if the user switches to DirectHttps some of these will not be relevant.

Is 'direct client' mean Direct TCP connection?
Client & connection overload confusing.

Is it to keep the connections warm?
How are broken connections identified? How will it impact the latencies/performance?
Guidance on when to tune to what values will help CX.
Include references to the Java perf best practices.

Am not fully clear on endpointIdletimeout vs connecitonideltimeout.
Lets please cover at depth the details.
How about a conceptual MD file in Github which can be referenced?
We can extend it with patterns and guidance (some parts might eventually get promoted to docs).
Also please refer the performance guide references across code docs extensively.
/cc: @David-Noble-at-work , @moderakh
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -98,49 +116,57 @@ public DirectConnectionConfig setIdleEndpointTimeout(Duration idleEndpointTimeou
     }
 
     /**
-     * Gets the max channels per endpoint
-     * @return the max channels per endpoint
+     * Gets the max connections per endpoint
+     * Default value is 30

nodes.bodyText: How about stating how these manifest for netty underlying for advanced users?
connection vs socket vs others: Is there guidance or patterns from azure SDK's?

commit.message: Updated docs with performance tips guide

nodes.bodyText: It is the idleConnectionTimeout that defaults to zero. The connectTimeout defaults to the value of requestTimeout: 60 seconds prior to this PR.

commit.message: Updated default connection timeout value and other documentation
